title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Pre requisite: Functional analysis, Topology, Measure Theory and Integration. Introduction: Fractal dimension, Housdorff fractal dimension, Fractal curves. Uses of No constrained Chance: random coastlines, empty invocation of chance versus actual description, Brownian motion, etc. Fractal Events and Noises: the Cantor set, Dimensions between 0 and 1, Average numbers of errors in the Cantorian model, Conditionally stationary error patterns, Clustering. Fractal Clusters of Stellar Matter, Turbulence, Intermittency and Curdling: analysis and geometry of turbulence, the problem of intermittency, and role of selfsimilar fractals. Singularities of equations of motion in physics as fractals. Certain conjectures. Meteorites, Moon craters and Apollonian models of soap. Applications of constrained models of chance: Joseph and Noah effects. Fractals in physics: Bernoulli percolation, pseudo fractal sequences, single crystal smectic filaments, and superconductors. Fractals, Brownian facets of rivers, Relief and turbulence.
